Кажется все игры серии Shelter - это боль. Сначала ты боишься потерять барсучат, потом рысят, а в этой части ты боишься, что рысёнок умрёт один или что он так и не найдёт свою семью. 
После этой части начинаешь не любить лебедей, хоть и понимаешь что там была защита гнезда; боишься, что вот сейчас вынернет из тумана лиса и убьёт тебя; переживаешь за медвежонка больше, чем за персонажа, которым играешь. 
Не знаю как остальные, но я испытывала огромный страх, когда в каждой локации приходилось оставлять на время позади медвежонка. Всё боялась, что я не смогу найти для него дорогу к себе. Но концовка истории с лисой - это нечто настолько прекрасное и светлое. После этого концовка игры выглядит довольно...неправильной? Не понимаю как можно было делать выбор между другом и семьёй. Кому-то выбор покажется очевидным, но я не могла смотреть на то, как он сидит на другом берегу, и слышать его ответный крик. Хотелось так и крикнуть "пожалуйста, дайте мне бревно!". [простите, если это прозвучит как спойлеры]. 

Но игра прекрасная, хотя соглашусь, что управление камерой - та ещё боль.

Если вам хочется поплакать, испытать всю красоту истинной дружбы и вы при этом вы любитель серии Shelter, то обязательно сыграйте! Да даже если и у вас не хватает одного-двух или всех описанных выше пунктов, то всё равно сыграйте! Игра не оставит вас равнодушными (если вы, конечно, в детстве не плакали над смертью Муфасы или что-то в этом роде). 

Ставлю твёрдую 9 из 10 этой игре.

37962084.review:
To start off with I must say I've become a Might & Delight fan since playing Shelter 2. It enticed me to buy the original Shelter, Paws, The Lonesome Fog and Meadow. As an experienced, hardcore gamer I couldn't anticipate how this series would grab hold of me and dig itself into my heart. Sometimes excruciatingly so.

Paws: A Shelter 2 Game is, as the title might suggest, a standalone spin off of the original Shelter 2 game. Here you play a Lynx cub that became separated from it's mother and siblings. A familiar scenario for anyone who has played Shelter 2, where losing cubs to natural disasters or predators was a very real threat. Players of Shelter 2 might also recognise Paws as a prequel to this game, as the standard name of the Lynx cub is... [spoiler] Inna. That's right, the original Mother Lynx you start Shelter 2 with![/spoiler] 

The main goal is to survive and find your way back to your familiy while looking through the cub's eyes and braving the dangers of the wilds, encountering a number of other animal species and discovering the mysteries of the world you live in. Paws breaths mystery. It is never apparent or obvious, but there seems to be some kind of vibe that speaks to you on an almost primitive, subconcious level. 

The game is best described as an impressionistic image of the wilds and the place the Lynx family has in it. Although graphically far from photorealistic, the "painted fairytale storybook" style is the best looking installment of the series yet, accompanied by stunningly beautiful and sensitive music that fits the setting prefectly and amplifies the experience. On the surface Paws seems simple, but it appeals strongly to your perception and emotions, sometimes up to the level of actual tears and heartache. Anyone who has ever been lonely or scared can't help but feel empathy with the Lynx cub's predicament, especially when facing a very emotionally difficult choice at the end. 

If you love animals, animal based stories, fairytales, want to be amazed by a simple but powerful emotional tale, or if you are looking for something completely different for a change I'd highly recommend that you buy this game. And Buy Shelter 2 while you're at it for context.

36365520.review:
6/10 - Cute, but lacking in some areas. User input options and controls need work.

I try to be fair in any review that isn't a joke, so I'll endeavor to do the same here.

We'll start with what most people notice about the game, which is the visuals. The models are cute and the textures quilt-like, which is very pleasing to the eye, and the animal sounds are pretty good. For Shelter 1 & 2, this definitely made it pop. Now that we are on at least 4 different games (or interactive media) that all have the same visual style, their visual unity is all the more apparent. It's also for this reason that it's not breath-taking in its own right anymore; birds fly, fish swim, Might and Delight make cute, nice-looking animal games. Like all of their titles, the soundtrack is quite pleasing when it wants to be and makes some nice use of simple instrumentals. It's nothing ground-breaking, but I think it does the job reasonably well for the communication of tense or calm moments.

The biggest issue you'll likely have playing this game is the controls and camera. The controls are slippery, temperamental, and can get you killed if you are in any part of the game that requires precision or timing, like when a fox comes by. It's extremely difficult to get the lynx to jump where it's supposed to, and there are points where you will find yourself unable to jump up a ledge because the bear suddenly stops being registered as something to jump on by the game. There isn't much to tell you what the buttons do, either, which wasn't a huge issue for my own playthrough but seems to have lead to a number of new players getting confused. All of this is exacerbated by being unable to zoom and move the camera very well; it's always quite close-up and tends to get stuck in things. All of this is enough to make it difficult for me to play it for very long stretches, and losing out on a collectible simply because the bear stopped dancing and won't let you land on its back anymore for some reason gets wearying.

As I consider the gameplay and usability of a game to be the most important aspects before building anything on top of that, and that Paws is not really trying to be a piece of art wherein every aspect plays a pivotal role, we can try stripping away the purely visual aspects and see what we're left with. A simple story with endearing little animals that gets let down by janky controls and an annoying camera. It's more solid than a lot of other titles and digital toys out there and it has a well-defined beginning and end(s), but the gameplay just isn't as enjoyable as it could be and most of the challenge comes from the controls of the game rather than the game itself or any conscious gameplay design choices. If you're a diehard fan of the Shelter series, you may enjoy it or you may be let down by how different this one pilots. If you're new to Shelter, this game's tone fits well but may give you a somewhat-inaccurate view of the series. Hence I will give Paws: A Shelter Game a hesitant 6/10, which is still "above average" but has room for improvement.

34363934.review:
I'll just say the obvious right then and there: this game is adorable. From the main protagonist to even the things that's supposed to be your enemy they are extremely cute. The story follows a lynx cub gets lost from his/her mother and teams up with a bear cub to find her again. That isn't a bad story idea, but you know what else isn't a bad idea?

Pros: 
- [b] this game is extremely cute [/b]
- It was fun, short lived entertainment.
- The graphic design was fairly decent.
- The story is a basic formula, but hey! No dying cats this time!... unless you count the missing cub at the end. 
- I like the easter eggs.

Cons:
- The camera and controls are downright AWFUL. I'm supposed to be looking for my bear buddy but my lynx is doing 9,000 backflips and the camera is having a seziure! 
- The game is too short. If I don't count the times I got stuck this game could be completed within 1.2 hours. 
- The graphics are also very hard to look at sometimes. I remember I got stuck for a while because I thought a bush was apart of the ground. 

Overall, should you play this? It's pretty much matter of opinion. If you liked the original Shelter games, you might enjoy this Shelter 2 spinoff. Or if you like nature games or lynxes it's also a possibility you might like this. I personally enjoyed this, but what about you?

34183231.review:
I had loved the first and second games, and I also decided to get this game. From the trailers, I decided it was a game where you played as a lynx cub, stayed with your family, escaped danger, and grow up and leave your mother. Then you would survive on your own, find a mate, and leave them to raise your family. Then you would have to play Shelter 2. I was so wrong. Below is the story, which I recommend not reading for the game is best going in blind.

[spoiler] In Paws you play as a lynx cub, with you lynx family. Any new player would immediatly get attached with their family, for you play around with your siblings and follow your mother. After sleeping on the second day, you wake up near dawn to see your mother walking away from the den. You follow your mother  up a hill and see a star. After looking at the star for a while, it floats into the sky. Then you and your mother go to sleep.
When you wake up its all cloudy. You follow your mother out of the den, over a log, and then the story progresses. Then its raining. You and your siblings are most likely either scared, tired, or hungry, for when you meow, you sound more depressed. 
Then you come across a river. Your mother picks you up and walks across it, your siblings swimming along. Then a wave washes you out of your mother's grasp. You get stunned in the water for a second when you start to swim along. Your mother picks up one of your siblings and the other two make it onto shore. But then another wave comes. Your mother puts the other cub on the shore and runs after you. The wave then washes you away before your mother can grab you.
You then wake up and proceed to search for your family. After traveling, following your family's footprints, and resting, you wake up due to a pack of hunting wolves. You run along, and meet a bear cub. After feeding it three birds or berries, it will become strong again and follow you around, helping you. 
At some point of your search, you'll come to a foggy area. If you sniff around, you can find a hidden 'ghost' of your family.  But a fox is also among the ghost, and in it the fox seems to be hunting your other three siblings. Then you go through a tunnel and need to find a way for your bear friend to follow you. You then will enter a foggy bit, and music will start playing. There are platforms that you can jump onto, which is important to do because the fox will attempt to attack you.
If you get attacked, then the screen will go black and you can hear the fox biting into the cub when the bear suddenly attacks it and chases the fox off. You will then wake up in a den that the bear brought you two. It will leave and come back with a fish. The bear then drops the fish and covers the den with branches to camoflauge it.
When you wake up you will walk along as normal but then your friend will run off. If you follow the bear, then you will come across a river.
Across the river is your mother and two of your siblings. Here you have the choice. Swim across the river to your family or stay with your bear friend. If you go with your mother, then everytime you try to go back your mother will pick you up. If you go with your bear friend, your friend will eat one berry bushes and you go through them to go to a den. It also is possible to go with your mother and when she goes to sleep with your siblings, you can go across the river to your bear and go with the bear ending, but only if you had your friend eat the bushes first.
At the ending, you climb up a hill and see a star come down. You will see who you left behind, which I found heartbreaking. [/spoiler]

Strangly, the other Shelter games didn't make me cry when a cub died or when I got to the ending. But when I got to the ending of Paws for the first time, I cried. Even when I see the ending now, I still feel sad. Its pretty rare for a game to make me cry, and even more rare for me to feel the same feeling at the same part over and over again.

Shelter 2'nin atmosferinde devam ediyoruz maceramıza. Shelter 2'nin hikayesini de oynanışını da pek beğenmemiştim fakat bu defa minnaklardan birisini canlandırdığımız ve bunu da, en azından başlarda çok tatlı bir havayla yaptığımız, o aile saadetini dibine kadar yaşadığımız için çok beğendim.

Charles Mclain adlı oyuncu çok güzel bir oynanış incelemesi yaptığı için o konulara hiç girmiyorum. Shelter 1'in hikayesi ve Shelter 2'nin oynanış mekanikleriyle hoş bir hikaye. Öneririm.

EDİT: "Pitter Patter Edition" dediklerinde, "Lonesome Fog" adlı çizim hikayesi ve oyunun OST'si de geliyor. Ben o sürümünü almıştım indirimde ve memnun kaldım. Deneyimi geliştirmek için ideal.

Let's get it out of the way - yes, this is a short game. I finished it in just under 90 minutes, though I'm sure you can extend that to about 2 hours if you try searching for all the little tidbits laying around. But even with that, I can assure you the game is entirely worth your while.
The gameplay itself is decent - I had a bit of irritation over how 'sluggish' the mouse controls were, but it wasn't any bit seriously  bad. Just made tackling the birds or frogs a bit harder.
The soundtrack is lovely, and helps evoke the perfect feeling for whatever scenario that pops up - and while I won't give spoilers, it would either leave you on the edge of your seat or holding your heart.

Yes, the graphics aren't much to look at - but graphics aren't everything, and even so, for me, the graphics themselves in fact help enhance the game's feel. Not quite detailed, yet at the same time detailed enough for everything to 'feel' there.

And lastly - the game's able to tug at your heartstrings with absolute ease, especially with the ending it has. I won't go spoiling it, but no matter which choice you make I can assure you that you'll be at the very least, choking up, let alone bawling just as I was.

If you have 2 hours to spare, I can assure you that this game would be  worth every cent of you buying it.

32158621.review:
This game is beautiful and wonderful. Just from the beginning, you can tell that Might and Delight put lots of work into the designs and patterns in the forest. I say that this game is adorable and takes you on a little lynx's journey throughout her first steps. 
Get ready for a rollarcoaster:

SPOILERS: TURN BACK NOW IF YOU WANT TO!

You start out as a little lynx, snuggled up with her siblings at her mother's lap. Then, the mother takes them out for the first time. You get to play games, tackle your brothers and sisters, and eat your first prey. Then, your mother takes you to the river, where you play and run. Then, it overflows. Squealing at the top of your lungs, you are carried across the river by your mother. But then, another kitten squeaks for help. The mother trips and loses you. You yowl for help, and the mother turns around and sees you being carried away. She yowls back, racing desprately to reach you. But a huge wave crashes on top of both you and your mother, and you are carried away as your mother continues to yowl and run after you.
You wash up on a creek bed. You open your eyes and explore. Mean swans thrust you about and you get scared from all the big birds. You are trampled from a deer herd, and you try hard to sniff out the trail to your mother. You sniff, following the scent. Sometimes you can see the outlines of you mother, her and your littermates calling your name. They are searching for you, like you are for them. Soon, weary and tired, you come to a clearing in the forest. There, sleeping in the middle, is a lost, little bear cub.
You hunt for the bear. The bear cub eats three finches before it walks around with you. Maybe he could help you find your mother...

This game is adorable, I've said that already but I can't say it enough. It's heartbreakingly lovingly. If you want to see a fan-fiction version of this, go to my screenshots and start from the beginning. This game is fun, but there are TWO IMPORTANT THINGS that YOU and MIGHT AND DELIGHT need to know:

1. This game is super quick. I finished it in three hours. Not worth $15, despite the amazing graphics and attention put into it. More like $10. But I still 100% recommend it.
2. To make the lynx look up, you have to right click, hold it, and scroll DOWN. I mean, I got used to it, but it still threw me off. Maybe you could fix this?

So, to come to a conculsion, this game is fun, safe, singleplayer, and has beautiful graphics and designs.

Everything is questioned when in nature

Paws: A Shelter 2 Game is a tense and emotional experience you should make time to play. The whole game isn't much longer than an hour or two in length, but that brief time spent is really something remarkable

I warn you it will get to you!

One minute you will be laughing and then suddenly you will find yourself feeling emotions of sadness, this a bitter-sweet game which tells a story of which I feel is so honest.
 
I see the price has been moaned about quite a bit on here as the game is relatively short, however I think the price is just right, if the game is played properly you will get much more out of it, the aim (FOR ME) is not just to get to the end by rushing through it (there are two endings) also 'memories' to collect as you progress through, personally I think these should have been a necessary part of completing the game, also giving you the freedom of revisiting past locations and perhaps offering a much more open world (just a suggestion) 

To a point I understand why the developers have made it so you can just race through it not actually needing to collect anything, it's very hard to please everyone and I can see a good few people on here that would just give up on the basis of not being able to find a certain memory, plus some people don't appear to like backtracking.

This game has a lot to offer, the challenges are there should you choose to take them on, most of us older gamers were sat playing happily for hours on a commodore 64 when we were younger, accepting the simplest and hardest of challenges, and believe me one short game could take hours when setting challenges for yourself, my point being at the risk of sounding old - some of todays gamers don't like challenge because 'it's to hard' or 'time-consuming' do the achievements here to get the most out of the game, there's definitely a few extra hours of playtime to be had.   

Also, I would like to point out that In Shelter 1 and 2 food is a must! but in this game it really doesn't appear to matter if you eat or not, you never seem to get tired, weak or hungry but seeing as there is plenty of food about anyway this statement is slightly irrelevant but it would have added a little more challenge to the game should you have needed to feed at certain points throughout your journey.

As I said there is plenty of food around coupled with some achievements (if you catch the required amount of whatever meal) so again if you take some time to do a little hunting eventually you will be rewarded with an achievement, this is another reason to replay or to spend some extra time on your first run though.

The camera as in all the shelter games can be annoying at some points making perhaps the simplest of tasks rather tricky but far from impossible.

Take your time with it and really soak in the atmosphere and beautiful surroundings, annoy the angry swan, chase the birds and frogs and try leaping at the butterflies, these are the things a naughty baby lynx enjoys getting up to in the wild! Especially annoying that swan!

Beautiful game, amazing soundtrack, well worth the money, another title to keep where it's nice and warm - close to your heart.

9/10 ;-)

29536902.review:
Yet another beautiful game in the Shelter series and like the others, Paws is both simplistic and emotional. It dishes out a delightful story that sticks true to nature and really puts you in the 'paws' of your lynx cub character. 

The game is perfectly made in every way. I mean, cute little mewling sounds are just so darn adorable. But there are a couple of cons to this that in no way made me think bad or even get annoyed at it. Just slight inconveniences really.

The controls are a tad oversensitive when controlling the camera. This can take a little time getting used to but every game has its unique feel and Paws certainly gives you plenty of breathing room to master the controls.

If you, like me, love going for achievements too, just be aware the game will only reward you the ones you've earned once you've shut down the game. This makes it hard, especially for the puff ball achievement, to keep track of how many you've knocked off. 

I found this game to have no real challenge, just simple fun. The previous Shelter games did have more challenges to them. This doesn't change my love for this game, however I do wish there were points in it that enacted serious danger to both characters to put across how deadly the real world is to young cubs alone in the wild. 

Overall a delightful game, beautiful storyline, and certainly pulls on the emotional strings to your heart. I highly recommend this game if you love playing as animals. You don't have to worry about playing the other Shelter games as they all have separate stories. This game is very short but the enjoyment goes on forever. Give it a try!

Also, beware the swans. Those buggers are nasty! ;)

28032558.review:
Short and simple though it may be, Paws has a depth of storytelling far beyond what its humble mechanics and production values let on. Through evocative use of symbolism, animal sounds, visual interactions, the occasional line of poetic verse, tonally spot-on music (Retro Family never disappoints!), and its signature abstract storybook art direction, Might and Delight manages to tell a powerful, bittersweet tale about the bonds that tie nature together--the unbreakable bond that connects Inna with her family even from afar, as well as the unlikely bond that builds between Inna and the bear cub, and fosters a will to survive within them both. Paws is off the charts cute and tugs hard on the heartstrings in all the right ways. 

Read my full review at: http://www.vgblogger.com/review-paws/37132/

Disclosure: I reviewed the game from a free code provided by Might and Delight.

26251493.review:
This game is beautiful, sweet and absolutely adorable! But there were too many drawbacks keeping me from actually enjoying it.

This game might be more aptly titled "Lost in the Woods Simulator 2016". The dizzying watercolors of the environment mixed with similar-themed areas make it very difficult to find your way. There is a 'sense' mode where you can sniff to try and find your mother, and sometimes her paw prints will appear in a trail, showing you the way. My issue with this was that 1) these hints didn't appear often enough for me and 2) when they did appear, it was extremely difficult to tell which way they were leading. I spent way too much time just walking around in circles, trying to find my way.

The controls are not explained very well, not even if you explicitly go into the keybindings menu. When I found the baby bear and it was clear he was hungry and I had to feed him in order to wake him up, I had SUCH a difficult time figuring out how to pick up food and bring it to him without eating it myself.

If it wasn't for the confusion completely jarring me out of the experience, both through the environment and the keybindings (I was playing with an Xbox controller btw), it would be a really cute game. I feel that either the implementation of a minimap or a clear idea of which direction's the mother lynx's paw prints are going would at the very least make this a less painful game to play.

24549168.review:
Name (sofern man ihn nicht ändert) und Fellfärbung unseres jungen Luchsmädchens lassen mich darauf schließen, dass uns die Geschichte von "Paws" nicht nur ins selbe Universum von Shelter 2, sondern sogar im Rahmen eines Prequels in die Kindheit unserer Protagonistin aus Shelter 2 versetzt. Eine sehr schöne Idee, die nach meinem bisherigen Eindruck genauso gut umgesetzt ist wie schon Shelter 2 es war. Mehr möchte ich hier über die Story nicht verraten, es sei aber gesagt: mich hat diese schon nach knapp einer Stunde bisheriger Spielzeit mehrmals wirklich berührt. 

Das Gameplay selbst ist eine in meinen Augen gelunge Mischung der verbesserten Shelter 2 Mechaniken gekoppelt an den eher linearen Ablauf des ersten Teils. Dazu kommen Neuerungen wie Plattformer Passagen, Puzzle und die Möglichkeit mit dem Raubtiersinn jetzt auch Fährten zu erfassen und diese gezielt zu verfolgen.

Lobend zu erwähnen wären auch der wieder einmal auf den Punkt getroffene, wunderschöne, aber nie aufdringliche Soundtrack und die tolle, ausgefallene grafische Umsetzung. 

Mittelpunkt bleibt allerdings immer die ergreifende Story und die ernste Grundthematik des harten Wildtierlebens. Darin glänzt Paws, genau wie seine Vorgänger, besonders und gerade das macht diese Reihe zu solch wertvollen Titeln.

Wer Tiere, Adventure und / oder schlicht ergreifende Geschichten liebt sollte diesen Titel - und falls noch nicht geschehen, und dem Survival Genre nicht ganz abgeneigt, auch die Vorgänger! - in jedem Fall in seine Bibliothek einreihen.

Paws: A Shelter 2 Game tells the story of a lynx cub that gets seperated from its family and tries to find the way back to them. On your way you must be very careful and sneaky as you walk through the swamp and the forest. By using your scent ability you can see your mothers footprints and thus easily follow them to continue... you'll meet a bear very soon and become friends with him. The bear will help you in finding your family and who knows, maybe you already found it? 

Gorgeous game with a lovely story and beautiful graphics. I was literally running around hearing "screenshot-worthy, screenshot-worthy...!" in my head and I did take a lot! Also hunting frogs, birds and butterflies is a fun-thing to do, there are few achievements to unlock by doing so. I recommend not to rush the story, take your time through the levels, check out everything and properly and you might find something of interest. Unfortunately the game doesn't take long to finish. I would've loved more story, collectables, dangerous/dramatic moments so I could've enjoyed it even longer.

23411886.review:
Have you ever wondered what the world looked like through the eyes of a lynx? Perhaps they are your favourite animal or you’re just interested in the species or animal kingdom. Whatever the case, [i][b]Paws: A Shelter 2 Game[/b][/i] acts as both an educational game and also an immersion into the lynx life. Play as one of four cubs and begin a journey of love, triumph, friendship, loss, survival, and motherhood. Understand the complex relationship between life and nature - the very force that compels the choices we make.

If you are already familiar with the franchise and enjoyed it, in particular [i][b]Shelter 2[/b][/i], then you will be pleased to know that this game is very similar. It follows the same story line as its predecessor, but differs in that it now allows gamers to experience life through the lens of a young cub. As you control this particular cub you will experience a mother’s love and patience, a family’s warmth, and then almost suddenly, desperation and separation. Ultimately, this is a game that will pull at your heartstrings as fast as it will mend them. This is the game that introduces us to Inna.

[h1]---------------------------------------------------------[/h1]

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+ This is a game that you can definitely play with your family
+ New characters to meet and explore! The Goose is not a welcomed character though... 
+ It's a [i]Might and Delight[/i] game, and unfortunately I will always be biased and say they're great
+ Adorable sound effects and music. Very appropriate for the kind of game that this is and helps set the mood
+ You get to play as a lynx cub and piggy back on a bear cub: what more could you want?! Be aware, the bear cub can be quite tempermental
+ As always, [i][b]Paws: A Shelter 2 Game[/b][/i] is set within an artistically pleasing world; the graphics are unique to this franchise and offers real familiarity to those who know and love it
 
[h1] Neutral[/h1]
± Like all the other games in this franchise, the achievements take time and dedication to get; they are definitely no walk in the park. Prepare to spend a couple of days toiling over the locations of the rares, etc.
± Controls are both easy yet sometimes a hinderance. What I mean is controls are clunky  at times, like when you're trying to catch prey, but easy when you're doing small stuff (like basic maneuvering, running, and jumping)

[h1]Cons[/h1]
- To those who have played through the whole game: the ending - what?
- I suggest waiting for this game to go on sale before purchasing it. It's not worth the $14,99 price tag when you'll probably complete it in about 3 hours tops
- You will get lost from time to time. The lack of directions can be annoying and you will be backtracking a lot due to the lack of instructions. In the end, it's not fun at all and does detract from the overall quality of the game
- If you stray far off the path, then be prepared to glitch like hell... I managed to leave the path completely and ended up stuck between 3 tree's. I attempted to jump, crawl, and walk my way out, but to no avail. Out of frustration I ended up just closing the game only to lose all the progress I had made in that session. To say the least, I was [i]furious[/i]
- Do you suffer from motion sickness? If yes, then please be aware of your tolerance and take breaks accordingly. I’m easily affected by motion sickness, sadly, and the camera angles in this makes me feel like I'm aboard a ship. This is the number one flaw of the game, but I can understand the difficulties the developers have in trying to get it just right for every gamer. Mess around a bit with the settings - it may or may not help. As for me, I can only play about 20 minutes of this game before I have to exit it (reason behind my low play time)

[h1]---------------------------------------------------------[/h1]

Experience the raw power of nature and form a valuable bond along your journey. This is a riveting tale of friendship that withstands all odds. It will force you out of your comfort zone at times, and you will think considerably about every tough decision presented before you. While this game does have its issues that it can't seem to iron out, I still highly recommend it if you're a [i]Might and Delight[/i] fan. This is a great game to add to your [i]Shelter[/i] collection. 

All in all, brace yourself for heartbreak and other mood swings, for [i][b]Paws: A Shelter 2 Game[/b][/i] will tug at every ounce of your being.

[h1]Overall[/h1]

6.5/10

[h1]---------------------------------------------------------[/h1]

23229044.review:
所玩过的最好游戏


让我趴在电脑前哭的不成人样的游戏


玩这个游戏前，我认为这只是一个用卖萌来夺取眼球的资料片，认为不可能有shelter2那么沉重的剧情，也就是抱着随便玩玩的心态打开的游戏。

但玩没多久，我就发现自己完全被代入了这个游戏，当我和猞猁妈妈被水冲散时，遇到狼时，遇到那只小熊时等等等等，我的心完全连着剧情，这种感觉难以言表。

玩到后面，小熊帮我找到了妈妈，她和我的兄弟们就在河对岸，我迫不及待的游了过去，游到一半时，我听到后面小熊的叫声，就明白了：小熊不可能跟我们一起走。

然而找到妈妈的心还是让我继续向前游，终于，母子团聚了，准备带着我离开了，这时我又想到了对岸的熊，我知道游过去是不可能的，我坐在岸边，想要多看看它，这时电脑前的我，眼泪已经顺着脸颊流了下来，这种感觉，甚至比shelter2子女离去还让人痛心。

这时猞猁妈妈过来，把我叼起，向另一边走了，对面小熊的叫声我还能听见，猞猁妈妈一把我放下来，我就又向河岸跑去，但没跑到一半，又被猞猁妈妈叼走了，电脑前的我已经泪流满面，趴在电脑前哭了起来，至于小猞猁如何和妈妈到栖身的地方，又如何入睡的，我完全不知道。

这是一个超越游戏的游戏，我玩过这么多游戏，从未发现过如此优秀的游戏，它将游戏从消遣品提升到了艺术品的境界，其音乐，画风，剧情配合的恰当好处，总之，这是一个能让我一个一米八的大男人，趴在电脑前哭的不成人样的游戏，也行是我对这个系列的游戏没有抵抗力吧，但我不得不说，这个游戏非常完美。

其实这个游戏剧情是不短的，bug相对shelter2多了点，但完全不影响游戏体验。

i would avoid this game if you do not own a controller. the keyboard and mouse controls take a lot of fiddling with to get it to be somewhat playable, but even then it is a constant wrestle with the camera.

the paws method of guiding could have been a little better, as the paws highlight in the direction you're facing. if you're being turned around by the bad keyboard and mouse controls, things can get confusing, meaning accidental back tracking. it was not always immediately obvious where to go (i got stuck on the mountain as a jump to make was not made clear enough).

it's a shame the game lets down people that don't own controllers, or prefer not to use them.

22727037.review:
Might and Delight‘ın yapım ve yayıncılığını üstlendiği Paws: A Shelter 2 Game, Shelter 2 dünyasında geçen hikaye üzerine yoğunlaşmış bir macera ve platform oyunu. Hikaye diyorum çünkü ilk iki Shelter oyununda her ne kadar hikayenizi açık dünyada siz oluşturuyor olsanız da bu oyunda aynı durum mevcut değil. Büyük oranda bir aile hikayesi Paws: A Shelter 2 Game ve ayrıca bir dostluk hikayesi… Hal böyle olunca olay örgüsü de tamamen çizgisel ilerliyor ancak içerisinde bir-iki ufak sürpriz bulunuyor.

Oyunda Shelter 2‘den de hatırlayacağımız kedigillerden bir vaşağı canlandırıyoruz. Ancak bu sefer işler biraz tersine dönüyor çünkü bir anne vaşağı değil yavrusunu yönetiyoruz. Oyun başlarında annemiz sayesinde beslenmeyi, avlanmayı öğreniyoruz. Kontroller bize hikayeye yedirilmiş bir biçimde aktarılıyor ancak ilk açılışta ne yapacağımız konusunda bize çok fazla bir bildirim yapılmadığı için başıboş dolaşıyoruz. Bu esnada diğer yavrularla ilişkimiz hoş bir durum yaratıyor. Diğer yavrular çevrede koşturup duruyor, kelebeklere saldırıyor, bizi itip kaçıyorlar. Tüm bunlar bir aileye ait olduğumuz hissini ve atmosferini yaratmakta fazlasıyla yeterli. Biz de kendimizi onlara ayak uydurmuş buluyoruz ve annemizin yanında günlerimizi geçiriyoruz.

Paws‘ın hikayesinden detaylı bir şekilde değil de kabaca bahsetmek gerekiyor çünkü oynanış süresi ne yazık ki çok kısa. Shelter 1 ve Shelter 2‘nin tekrar oynanabilirliğini düşündüğümüzde oyuna her başladığımızda bu sefer kaç yavruyu kurtarabileceğimizi planlıyorduk. Bu ilk iki oyunun açık dünya olması vasıtasıyla oyun süremizi biz belirleyebiliyor, istediğimiz şekilde oynayabiliyorduk. Paws: A Shelter 2 Game söz konusu olduğunda ise bu durum ne kadar hızlı oynadığımızla alakalı. Oyunda yine geniş alanlar bulmak mümkün. Çevreyi isteğimize bağlı keşfedebilir ve toplanabilir eşyaları bulmaya çalışabiliriz. Toplanabilirler dışında ayrıca bir de anılar bulunmakta. Bu anılar yine toplanabilir eşyalar gibi bulunuyor ve anı defterini oluşturmaya çalışıyoruz. Bu anı defterinde karşılaştığımız durumlarla ilgili resimler bulunuyor. Hikayeye herhangi bir etkisi yok tabi ki ancak oyunda gizli saklı ekstra bir takım durumlara şahitlik edebiliriz. Gelelim oyun süresine… Eğer yukarıda bahsetmiş olduğum başarım ve koleksiyon sevginiz ağır basmıyor ise, oyunu 1 saat gibi kısa bir süre içinde bitirebiliyorsunuz. Bu süre Shelter hayranlarını bile sıkıntıya sokabilecek bir durum. Kaldı ki oyun için istenilen ücret, oynanışın sunduğu içerikle pek örtüşmüyor denilebilir. Fakat farklı bir açıdan baktığımızda hikayenin size sunduğu ve oyun sonunda hissettirdiği, oynanış süresinden daha ağır basabiliyor. Kısacası Paws: A Shelter 2 Game’in bir deneyim olduğunu göz önüne alırsak bu durum oyuncuyu biraz daha rahatlatabilir. Gelgelelim hikayeden bahsedecek olursak, oyun deneyimini baltalamamak adına kısa bir açıklama yapabiliriz. Bir yavru olarak annemiz ve kardeşlerimizden ayrı düşüyoruz. Bundan sonra ise ailemizin izlerini takip edip onlara kavuşmaya çalışıyoruz. Bu süreçte bir de ayı yavrusuna rastlıyoruz ve kendisi bizim yoldaşımız oluyor. Yolundan ayrı düşmüş iki yavru olarak maceramıza devam ediyoruz.

İlk iki oyundaki gibi hayatta kalma elementlerinin bu oyunda sadece hikaye odaklı olduğunu söylemek gerek. Herhangi bir şey yemesek de oyunda hayatta kalabiliyor, düşmanlardan darbe yediğimizde herhangi kötü bir sonuçla karşılaşmıyoruz. Tek yapmamız gereken eğer bir durum için yiyecek bulmamız gerektiği söylenirse yiyecek bulmak. Bu durum da zaten bir kaç kez gerçekleşiyor. Onun haricinde oyuna herhangi bir etkisi yok.

Grafik seçimi olarak Shelter serisi kendine güzel bir yer edinmiş durumda. Aynı sanat dizaynını Paws: A Shelter 2 Game’da da görebiliyoruz. Çizimler sanki birer resim gibi duruyor. Her karesi göze çekici gözüküyor. Ancak ufak bir çekiştirme yapmam gerekirse, bazı doku detaylarının, yakınlaşıldığında çok düşük kalitede gözüktüğünü söyleyebilirim. Fakat bu tabi ki sadece bir değerlendirme. Oyuna herhangi bir eksisi yok çünkü grafikler, oyunun temasıyla genel manada çok iyi uyuşuyor. Oyundaki müzikleri yine serideki diğer oyunlardan da tanıdığımız İsviçre asıllı Retro Family yapıyor. Bu gitar, bas ve piyanodan oluşan müzikler atmosferi tam anlamıyla yakalıyor. Kimi zaman ise oyun müzikten arınıyor ve yalnızlık hislerimiz kabarıyor. Bu dengeyi çok iyi yakaladıklarını rahatlıkla söyleyebilirim.

Son söz olarak, Paws: A Shelter 2 Game oynanış süresi bakımından çok kısa ancak öz bir şekilde bir hikaye anlatan ve sonucunda hislerimizi tırmalayan bir oyun. Eğer zengin bir oynanış düşünüyorsanız beklentilerinizi Paws: A Shelter 2 Game’de bulacağınızı söylemek zor ancak bir hikaye olarak dokunaklı bir oyun. 2 adet sonu bulunduğunu düşünürsek, ikinci oynayışta hem eksik kalan eşyalar toplanabilir hem de farklı sona ulaşmaya çalışılabilir. Bu sayede oyun süresi 2 ile 3 saat arasında artabilir.

İncelememin uzun versiyonunu [url=http://leadergamer.com.tr/paws-shelter-2-game-inceleme-81238.html]Leadergamer[/url]'da bulabilirsiniz.

22362486.review:
TL;DR: If you want this game, get it on sale. But be aware that it is short and also has a terrible camera and clunky controls. Also if you often get motion sickness from games, this might cause problems for you. 

Longer version: 

This game is cute. I really really wanted to really enjoy it, even knowing that it was just going to be a short romp. 

Unfortunately trying to play with mouse and keyboard was an absolute nightmare. I spent a while just trying to make the camera not a wildly swinging around pain in the ass, and eventually just gave up and settled on the static camera so I could actually start playing. And even once I did start playing, I had to keep stopping to close my eyes and deep breathe because I was getting incredibly motion sick.

The controls are.. meh. I don't know. It felt like even with the sensitivity turned down trying to move around would often result in me having to zig zag around, making my motion sickness worse. It's weirdly difficult to get back to moving in a straight line.

I'm sure, with a lot of fiddling around, I could have the controls and camera be actually manageable, but who even knows about the motion sickness. It's a real deal breaker for me, though I'm sure I'll try playing again anyway. It's still something you should keep in mind if you also get motion sickness from games.

Paws ist ein Spiel, welches sehr ähnlich wie Shelter 2 ist. Von der Grafik nahezu identisch. Nur dass ihr dießmal nicht die Mutter spielt sondern ein Luchsbaby! Shelter 2 war ein Open World Game und dies hier ist wesentlich linearer. Dies empfand ich hier aber nicht schlimm, obwohl ich eig. eher ein Fan von Open World bin. Aber hier passt es einfach alles gut. 

Ich persönlich fand das Spiel sehr sehr süß gemacht und mich hats emotional auch nicht kalt gelassen, vor allem nicht das Ende. (keine Sorge, gespoilert wird nicht). 
Großer Nachteil: Das Spiel ist seeehr kurz. Wenn ihr schnell seid könnt ihr das in einer halben Stunde locker beenden. Wenn ihr euch Zeit lasst und alles mitnehmen wollt, sowohl jeden EIndruck als auch Secrets (ja da gibts hier einiges) seid ihr gut 2 Stunden beschäftigt. 
Aufgrund der Länge des Spiels empfinde ich 15 € als absolut unangemessen, also entweder auf einen Sale warten oder woanders kaufen. Ich persönlich habs für 7€ bekommen und das war für mich ok, weil es ein echt schönes wenn auch kurzes Spiel ist. 
Aber die Entwickler hätten viel mehr aus der Story machen können und das ist schade.


Trotzdem, alles in allem ein schönes Spiel welches mir sehr viel Spaß gemacht hat und ich fühlte mich in jeder Sekunde des spielens wohl! :)

Also: Kaufempfehlung!

22147677.review:
Paws is a cute little game.  The art style is beautiful as always, and the story is emotional without needing a single word spoken.  I really love this game, and I'll be going back to grab the secrets in another playthrough.  But I just can't recommend this game.

1. "Platformer," as stated in the description of the game, is a bit of a stretch.  Basically, you just jump up stairs.

2. The controls are awful.  I used a keyboard & mouse, and had to fiddle with the settings quite a bit to make it playable.  Even with tweaked settings, the camera is hard to work with, and the mouse movements are not precise.  The log bit was probably the worst, as the log would never turn in the direction I wanted.  Who knows, maybe a controller is the only way to go.

3. Game time.  In my eyes, you should be able to have at LEAST as many hours of fun as the game costs.  This game costs $14.99 and my first main playthrough (the fun bit) didn't even last an hour.  To me, this game is worth $4.99 max.

Meow.

[i]Paws[/i] is a fantastic game about a kitten getting separated from its mother and needing to find the way back home to its family.

[b]STORY[/b]
The story is a very sad one, from the second you see the kitten ripped away from its mother, tofending yourself from various enemies across your travels, even to the last part of the game when you reunite with your family, you must make a choice on what you want to do. It's a very sad and yet a very happy story.

[b]GRAPHICS[/b]
Paws has a very interresting artstyle, very similar to N64 graphics. The game is created out of polygons, yet even through that it's a beautiful game. It gets you immersed in the game instantly, the textures on such simple shapes draw you in and make you want to stay. Paws is an admirable game for this reason; I have never found a game that provides this feeling.

[b]GAMEPLAY[/b]
This game runs perfectly; at even the highest settings, it runs perfectly for many people. As the graphics are mere polygons, it's not too hard for any PC to handle. The controls are smooth as well, acting like they should properly. The subtlest buttons can do great things however. The LMB has you meow, this is your way on communication. You can talk to other animals this way, and it's too cute for words. One flaw with the gameplay is that when you rotate, you don't go right into facing that direction, the cat has to do an actual turn, which can cause some problems if you're being chased. Though overall, it's perfect. 

[b]OVERALL[/b]
Overall, this game is amazing. It has a deep story that drags you in from the second it starts to the second it ends. The graphics are simple shapes, yet beautiful and really set the mood for an adventure story. The game runs smoothly as well, reacting as you'd probably want it to. I recommend this game for sure, this game is revolutionary in my opinion, showing something that seems so basic can be an amazing work of art.

[b]RATING[/b]
The game gets: [i]4.5/5[/i]

22090227.review:
NOTE my down vote is NOT because this is a bad game! Do read this before making a choice!!!


Where to begin... I guess firstly we take a look at price tag and content. It took me 3 hours for this game because I wanted both endings, the second playthrough finished faster because I knew what I was going for. So is $15 worth for a game of 3 hours? Well I'm here to explain the game and you decide.

Now in Paws unlike the previous titles, you actually play as a cub! A lynx cub. You're separated from family and you're off to an adventure to find them. Along the way you meet a companion and later in the game you will find yourself at a crossroad on which side to pick.

The world did get expanded... a little I guess. There are the same old collectibles as in Shelter 1 and 2 that doesn't really do anything aside from achievements. If anything though, I feel like the world is even more vivid than the previous titles and the atmosphere along with the background music playing during specific parts really set the atmosphere really well.

One part I was at a swamp-like area and the background music really set the mood that this place isn't very welcoming which was fantastic.

The AI is simple and works fine. Although the game still retains the 'feeding' mechanic from the previous titles, it does nothing. You don't get hungry or tired; you can sprint all day and get to the end w/o eating (or at least it seems that way. I didn't try as I ate along the way for immersion). There isn't a hunger/stamina indication so dunno why this is a thing.

The rest of the game's pretty linear as usual but you can explore each section of the game to find collectibles and just indulge yourself in the world. Speaking of indulging yourself, since you're playing as a little cub, you can left click to meow! It's so... ADORABLE. I almost fainted out of cuteness. 

Anyways back to the game. The narrative is quite different in this game. Some areas it's okay, there's a clear direction on where to go, other times it can get confusing. I was stuck at one part of the game for roughly 10-15 minutes because I didn't know where to go.

There's also a lack of real danger in the game as dying just resets to last saved point unlike in the previous titles where danger eats your family. Although this could be a feature as it allows you to fully experience the life of a lynx lost in the wilderness trying to return to her family. I know I enjoyed it.

So in conclusion, this game is more lively than its predecessors. Much more beautiful and the endings are both fantastic although I'm in favor for one over the other but that's just me. There are two endings so let that be a thing for you to think about as you play this game; a Friend ending and a Family ending.

**Minor Spoiler** 
If you're aiming for the friend ending, when you see foxes, let them attack you.
**Minor Spoiler ended**

So now back to the question for those who has never played this title series before. Is it worth $15 for a 2-3 hour game? It can even be longer if you're the kind of person who likes to achieve everything in a game. However, I was talking about it being a 2-3 hour game so I'll ask another question. How much does it take you to go watch a movie?

Because this is pretty much what it is. It's roughly more or less 1 hour and 40 minutes for the first playthrough as you explore the game and about an hour for the 2nd to reach the 2nd ending. It's dumb they don't have a checkpoint system where you can load back to the split path but whatever.

Treat this as more of a visual novel than anything else. Even 1 manga or a novel is roughly $10.

This is my personal opinion as a GAMER but $15 for a 3 hour game is a NOPE.

On the other side of the coin, as someone who loves cute and cuddly things and a story? $15 is cheap. I have tons of cute things that costed more than just $15.

22059906.review:
NOTE: Please realise this game is not meant to be like the two Shelter games. It is not an animal survival game, but a story driven game about exploration. I see too many people saying it is bad because it is not like the Shelter games. But it is not supposed to be like them.

On to my review then:
Paws.. there is a lot to say. I know you will be seeing me saying to not buy this game, even though I admit: I love it.
This game was great. Storytelling, music, gameplay, the emotions and how Might & Delight have a really good sense for telling stories from an animals perspective. 

But then there are the cons. This game is short. Hellishly short. And it saddens me, because I feel like there could have been so much more dangers happening and more bonding between the Lynx cub and her new found friend, the Bear cub.
Despite it being claimed as a puzzle-platformer, there was not very much of either. You do jump a lot and there are some areas that are freakishly well hidden, but it all sums up to not really being in that genre in the long run. If I had to put it anywhere, it's a lot like an explorable storybook, which would be okay if it was longer.

All in All: I am a hardcore (as hardcore as it gets) fan of Shelter 2. But even I can not really recommend this game entirely. It's beautiful, it's stunning and has a lot of exploration to offer, but it falls short on its length and on the platforming, as well as the connection between Lynx and Bear.  Perhaps there will be DLC to iron its issue out, but as it stands right now, you are better off sticking to Shelter 2.

22059595.review:
Might and Delight have certainly gone above and beyond with creating the worlds seen in their Shelter games. Paws: A Shelter 2 Game is a standalone expansion on Shelter 2. The music is absolutely beautiful as usual, and the patchwork style graphics take art seen in gaming to a new level.

Taking the role of a baby lynx learning the basics of survival in the wilderness, you follow your siblings and mother around, eating butterflies and other such critters.

Paws: A Shelter 2 Game weaves a beautiful yet heart-breaking story of a baby lynx who finds itself swept away from it's family by a freak wave. During your time in the wild, you put your recently learned skills to the test and follow the footsteps of your mother. Along the way you come across a friend who helps you get through the rough and unforgiving forest that has become your temporary home.

Will the baby lynx ever find it's mother again? Take a look at our [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JDQPYYY7jXs]gameplay and review video[/url], then head on over to Steam and get downloading!

[h1]Q&A With Might & Delight:[/h1]

[b]GameReviewsAU:[/b]
What prompted you to take Shelter 2 in the opposite direction by putting the player in the paws of one of the baby lynxes?

[b]Might & Delight:[/b]
It seemed a natural progression. A fact echoed by a vocal majority of our fans and supporters, who had made it clear they really wanted the chance to assume control of one of the younglings in a Shelter game. They told us what they wanted, we listened and et voila.

[b]GameReviewsAU:[/b]
The Shelter series is very much focused on motherhood. Is there a particular reason for you shining the spotlight on mothers?

[b]Might & Delight:[/b]
The theme is largely underrepresented in games. Not just motherhood, but parenthood as a whole and the wave of emotions that comes with the responsibility of taking care of young ones. Also, when trying to come up with the original Shelter concept, members of the team were either parents or making their first inroads into parenthood. That played a big part in the games theme.

[b]GameReviewsAU:[/b]
Where did you initially get the inspiration for the patchwork graphics seen in each Shelter game?

[b]Might & Delight:[/b]
It’s easy to assume both Shelter 1 and Shelter 2 have the same visual style, but they are born from two separate sources of inspiration. The first games visual style was heavily inspired by Japanese Kamon, which is a form of emblems used to uniquely identify a family or person - not unlike a coat of arms. Whilst the second Shelter was inspired by Russian embroidery ornament patterns.

[b]GameReviewsAU:[/b]
Why did you decide to release Paws as a standalone game rather than as DLC for Shelter 2?

[b]Might & Delight:[/b]
We felt since the gameplay and story explored different themes to the Shelter series, it warranted a spin-off. If it proves popular we would be open to developing the Paws concept further.

[b]GameReviewsAU:[/b]
A lot of people seem to be interested in co-op being implemented in Paws. Do you have plans to make this a reality?

[b]Might & Delight:[/b]
We try to listen to feedback from our fans and if there is genuine interest in another Shelter game or co-op then we would be silly to completely ignore it.

[b]GameReviewsAU:[/b]
Seeing as Shelter 2 has you playing as the mother lynx, and Paws has you controlling one of the babies, will you ever make a standalone game based on Shelter 1 where you play as a baby badger?

[b]Might & Delight:[/b]
Never say never.

[b]GameReviewsAU:[/b]
What can gamers expect to see from Might and Delight in the future?

[b]Might & Delight:[/b]
We also released what we call a living book along with Paws called The Lonesome Fog. It’s an opportunity to explore other ways of conveying narrative we’re excited about. Apart from that stay tuned for more announcements from us in the coming weeks.

[url=http://gamereviewsau.com/paws-a-shelter-2-game-gameplay-and-review/]Read the full review[/url]

22045228.review:
Pros:
- Sweet story
- Nice little levels to explore
- Easy to learn controls
- Family friendly

Cons:
- Short (play time for me was a little over 3 hours). Could've played for hours more.

If you're a fan of the Shelter games, this one is a must have. It has a more concrete story and levels like in Shelter 1, but follows a familiar Lynx cub from Shelter 2. The story is sweet and touching, and exploring the world is just as enjoyable as ever. 
Bear in mind that the levels are straightforward and not open world, so the opportunities to explore are limited. On the bright side, there is no chance of getting lost. Puzzles provided are simple, but work well in the game's setting. 

There are memories and collectables to collect, so if you're the type to want to 100% games, you might get a few playthroughs out of this, depending on how carefully you search when you play.

If you want a short enjoyable experience, Paws is a wonderful choice. It's just as cute as the trailer would have you believe.

22027375.review:
Перед началом игры у меня куча сомнений было на счет Paws, после первой удачной части, решили во второй части сделать размашистые локации, и следом за этим: унылый геймплей, корявый геймдизайн, и в целом всё низком уровне оказалось.

В Paws они решили убрать все раздражающие элементы второй части: 
Не нравятся большие локации — уберем, вместо этого они вернули трубу с минимум ответвлением в локации, по которой просто нужно идти, как в первой части.
Не нравится геймпей с выживание — уберем, теперь добыча пищи совсем тривиальная стала, и не требует каких-то усилий и времени, я даже полагаю, и нету чертовых, надоедливых хищников, которые то и дело раздражали.
Не нравится собирать сотню грибочков, две сотни растений ради ачивки— уберём, вместо этого за игру нужно собрать 13 яиц и 10 осколков памяти, которые не требуют каких-то усилий и времени в этом.
А так, игра стала более вылизана, и самое глпаное она не раздражает больше.

А теперь минусы:
Баги, и геймдизайнерские недочеты, проблемы возникают даже чтобы запрыгнуть на спину медведю.
Игра стала совсем коротка, и у меня прохождение заняло 70 минут, без поиска осколков и кругов памяти (на это еще минут ~40 уйдет времени). После прохождения игра не вызывает никаких эмоций, даже в конце игры, когда уже идут титры, ты сидишь с каменным лицом, где написано: "И это всё? Всё чем вы меня удивить хотели?". И это после двух частей, где ты близко к сердцу принимал утрату каждого детёныша, даже после дико скучного геймплея второй части, в конце ты умилялся концовке под очень приятную музыку: [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-mcDUgATFZ4&ab_channel=KiritaArtXV]Shelter 2 - Love[/url]
Но здесь этого вообще нет, ты просто прешься по трубе, с минимум геймплея. Звуки мира игры, как были ужасны во всех частях, так и остались на том же уровне. Игра даже не удивляет картинкой, все локации — это темные коридоры с мрачной обстановкой. Тут даже музыка стала совсем какой-то невзрачной и не запоминающейся, а та музыка, которая тебе вроде нравится, очень похожа на изменный саундтрек из второй части, да и часто вообще на локациях не играет хоть какая-то музыкка. 
Даже мишка не спасает ситуацию, хотя он должен был стать основой игры, судя по трейлеру, а появляется он в последней трети игры.
 
Жаль конечно говорить, но они сдулись окончательно, пора уже завязывать им с их концепцией: "Мать - дети". Они не смогли сделать самого главного: проявить у меня хоть какие-то эмоции, разве что вторая концовка игры хоть как-то выдавливает слезу, но это не спасает ситуацию, если бы они исправили все недечеты, которые тянуться с первой части, то получилась бы отличная первая часть Shelter.

Итог: очень слабенько, если не играл в прошлые части, то игра только раздрадать будет.
Но всё же, тем кому понравились прошлые части, я бы посоветовал пройти Paws.

22025898.review:
Wer vorab gerne einen kurzen Einblick ins Spiel hätte: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=733RhiiI3p8

"Paws" ist sehr nah an seinem "Papa" Shelter 2 dran, weder Umgebung/Grafik, Menü noch Storyline haben sich großartig verändert - aber das hatten die Entwickler ja bereits angekündigt. In diesem Teil spielen wir bloß nicht die Luchsmama, sondern eins der Jungen, das im Laufe des Spiels abhanden kommt. Hier kommt auch schon der Titel zum Tragen, "Paws": Die Handlung des Spiels besteht nämlich darin, zurück zu Mama und Geschwisterchen zu finden und das, indem wir ihre Spuren lesen, also nach ihren Tatzen Ausschau halten. Natürlich gibts draußen allerhand Gefahren (Es ist nun mal ein Survival Spiel), allzu viel Action sollte man jedoch nicht erwarten, da - wie in allen Shelter Teilen - auch hier wieder die Atmosphäre, welche auch Musik und Umgebungserkundung, Walking Simulationen, etc. beinhält, eine sehr große Rolle spielt. Kein Oberkracher der Titel aber für die Fans der ersten 2 Teile durchaus eine nette Möglichkeit.
